CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 24, 1951, pg. 1, reads: "Brutal Murder Draws Crowd - A crowd of several hundred persons gathered soon after word of the brutal slaying of 100-year-old George Howard in bed of his basement apartment at 708 Junilla Street, last Wednesday or Thursday, spread through the Hill District. The aged pensioner was bludgeoned to death either by a thief or thieves or someone intent on wreaking vengeance on him, homicide detectives believe.  The victim was found by an ice man when the latter stopped to deliver Howard's regular order of ice around noon Thursday.  The Courier photographer was on the scene to bring Courier readers a short pictorial story of events as they transpired.  Left to right: ...(2) - Part of the curious crowd milling around outside the apartment door trying to get a peek at the victim and the interior of the room in which he was murdered... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Crowd, including Pittsburgh Courier newspaper reporter Frank Bolden on right, gathered outside of apartment of murder victim George Howard, 708 Junilla Street, Hill District
